As the arguments from the prophetic periods were found to be impregnable, opposers endeavored to discourage investigation of the subject by teaching that the prophecies were sealed. Thus Protestants followed in the steps of Romanists. While the papal church withholds the Bible (see Appendix) from the people, Protestant churches claimed that an 
                                                                           341
important part of the Sacred Word--and that the part which brings to view truths specially applicable to our time--could not be understood.
